intro: Batrachium × segretii, commonly known as the hybrid violet, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are often arranged in clusters and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. Batrachium × segretii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland areas.
